channel.title: Software on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Software on My New Hugo Site

item.title: 2% Genius
item.description:
Agile Tsar Dmitri Dolguikh pointed out Project Euler yesterday, which is a website containing a series of short programming problems. It reads a bit like bonus questions on a math exam, which is actually quite refreshing compared to the day-to-day problems at work. For added fun, I’m trying to run through the problems in Common Lisp.

So far I have completed 4 out of 179 problems, which makes me 2% genius, according to the site.

item.title: A delightful typo: Paintain
item.description:
While discussing a new software feature, I made the following typo:

17:56 <@jbowes> and then people would use it, and then we'd have to paintain it 17:56 <@jbowes> i meant to type maintain, but that word is awesome

I think paintain aptly describes what many of us do daily.
